events.name: Slimstown Studios & Jibe Mobile Hackathon
events.about:
Do you have a mobile game youve been working on and want a little help to get it out the door? Do you have an idea for a game and just need some other talented people to help you create it? Do you simply love to code or create game art? 

Sign up for the Slimstown Studios & Jibe Mobile hackathon and create something amazing! Not only will you meet other great people in the mobile industry, but youll have the chance to win a publishing deal, cash, free QA testing, and more! Every participant will also walk away with a grab bag of goodies and will get to consume as many caffeinated and adult beverages as they want. Youll also get some good eats from one of the Bay Areas best food trucks, some mouth-watering BBQ, and, of course, lots of snacks.

Over the course of about two days, you and your team (whether you bring your own or form up with one at the event) will hack together a game that you think could be the next big thing due to its unadulterated fun, creativity, killer multiplayer, use of Jibes technology, or anything else amazing about it. Lone Wolves who can do it all on their own are welcome too.

Slimstown Studios and Jibe strongly encourage making a game using Unity. Jibes Unity plug-in provides low latency multiplayer capabilities for mobile gaming, available for Android at the hackathon. Games coded at the hackathon should be developed for either iOS or Android.

Sign up for the hackathon now!

(Note that each ticket has a nominal cost associated with it. Weve found that people who are willing to pay even a tiny amount of money are more likely to show up and be fully engaged, ensuring we can put on the best event possible for all of you!) 

Prizes

Well be handing out three sets of prizes to games picked by our panel of judges:

Grand Prize:

  • Publishing Contract with Slimstown Studios, providing marketing, PR, social media, cross-promotion, user testing, QA, and localization services.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for the life of the app*
  • A $500 voucher for QA services from VMC Game Labs, the worlds leading independent games QA solution provider, to be used for any game the winner chooses, not just the winning game. 
  • Lunch with Slimstown Studios executives. Ask for advice and get answers to any questions you have about production, marketing, startups, and just about anything else!

Best Multiplayer Games Built Using Jibe Android Unity Plug-In:

1st Prize

  • $5,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for the life of the app*
  • Lunch with Slimstown Studios executives. Ask for advice and get answers to any questions you have about production, marketing, startups, and just about anything else!
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

2nd Prize

  • $3,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for two years*
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

3rd Prize

  • $2,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for two years*
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

Schedule (times subject to change)

Friday, November 30
7:00pm - Registration/Networking
8:00pm - Introductory speeches and Seeking-A-Team Pitches
Midnight - Go home and get some sleep, or start coding at home

Saturday, December 1
9:00am - Registration/Networking
10:00am - Introductory speeches
10:30am - Coding begins
Noon - Lunch provided
7:00pm - Dinner provided
Midnight - Go home and get some sleep, or continue coding at home

Sunday, December 2
9:00am - Coding begins
Noon - Lunch provided
5:00pm - Coding ends, Dinner provided, and Team Presentations/Judging begins
7:00pm - Thanks for coming! Grab a gift bag on your way out and well see you next time! 

 

Hosts

Slimstown Studios is a mobile gaming company whose mission is to make extremely fun, industry-changing games with a social emphasis. Led by video game industry veterans, the company develops, funds, and publishes internal and external products.


Jibe Mobile provides an open platform that brings the missing layer of discovery, instant play and communications to multiplayer low latency mobile gaming.  With Jibes global communications cloud and open APIs, game creators can develop low latency multiplayer mobile games and easily add address book friend discovery and instant play game challenges even when the game is not running. Using Jibes SDK its also easy to add multiplayer voice, video and chat right into game play. www.jibemobile.com


Sponsors

events.name: Dream It, Build It, Do It! Hackathon
events.about:
Dream it, Build it, Do it! Hackathon

9th Nov 7:00 pm 2012 - 10th Nov 7:00 pm 2012

Change the way tasks are done. Forever.

 

Introduction - 

Easilydo fundamentally reimagines how people get things done. We are building the world’s first proactive assistant for people who want to feel accomplished and in control of their daily tasks. Easilydo is a mobile application that shows all your important to-do items and lets you respond right on the spot.  Prioritize and respond to emails, view and schedule reminders, post on Facebook, add Contacts and much more - all with a simple tap of the Do It button.

You are warmly invited to our Dream it, Hack it, Do it! Hackathon and contribute your ideas to our awesome repertoire of Do-its. The hackathon entry should follow the paradigm of:

If (event happens), offer to (do action).

Examples: 

  • When I am not at home, offer to show me map directions to go home.
  • When I receive an event invitation on Facebook, offer to add it to my Google Calendar.

Get your creative juices flowing and hack the next coolest Do-It the world has ever seen! 

Judging Criteria

Each entry has to be deployed to our server and will be given time to present their finished product. Judges will base their decisions on:

  • Time Saved: How much time does it save the end-user?
  • Innovation: How innovative is the idea? 
  • Delight Factor:  How delightful does the user feel after having it done? 

 

We look forward to your awesome creation!

Prizes

First place receives $1,000
Second place receives $750
Third place receives $500
Peoples Choice Award receives $250

Additionally, there will be raffles every 2 hours and all participants stand to win Apple Store gift cards! 

Schedule

Friday (9th Nov 2012)

19:00 Doors open
19:30 Welcome & overview by Easilydo CEO and judges
19:45 Easilydo architecture and infrastructure presentations by Directors of Engineering
20:00 Dinner and networking
21:00 Team forming and ideas pitching
22:00 Hacking begins!
 
Saturday (10th Nov 2012)

02:00 Supper surprise
08:00 Breakfast is served
08:30 Continue coding
13:00 Lunch is served
17:00 Submission of projects
17:30 Presentation, demonstration and judging
18:30

Winners announced and awards presentation

What you’ll need:

  • Laptop

What we’ll provide:

  • Food. Lots of it!
  • All the drinks you can drink
  • Easilydo server integration assistance

Rules:

  • The development tools, frameworks and application focus are entirely up to the participants but they must be able to integrate into Easilydos server.
  • Participants are expected to bring all tools and software necessary to build their entry. 
  • Participants may work by themselves or in a team of up to three.
  • Rules are subject to change.

If you have questions, please reach out to us here or email us at ande@easilydo.com

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Mountain View
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes! 

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

 In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: Startup Weekend by Google for Entrepreneurs
events.about:
Google for Entrepreneurs is teaming up with Startup Weekend to host a unique Startup Weekend at the new Google Ventures Startup Lab. The weekend will be filled with incredible mentors, judges, and speakers from Google and Google Ventures.  Everyone is welcome to apply to participate but only the first 100 candidates will be accepted. Food, drinks, and snacks will be provided.

Mentors


Mike Cassidy: Director of Product Management at Google. Founder of 4 acquired companies.

Dr. Frederik G. Pferdt: Global Program Manager for Innovation & Creativity at Google.

Steven Kan: Business Development Manager at Google. Vice President of Business Operations for Apture (acquired by Google).

Braden Kowitz: Design Partner, Google Ventures.

Jeson Patel: Engineering Manager at Google. Founder of SocialDeck (Acquired by Google).

Xander Pollock: Visual Designer at Google. Cofounding Designer of Punchd (Acquired by Google).


Speaker

Mike Cassidy

Mike Cassidy is the Director of Product Management at Google. Prior to joining Google, Mike Cassidy was the Co-Founder and CEO of four start-ups: Ruba, Xfire, Direct Hit, and Stylus Innovation. Ruba helped travelers share their favorite places and was acquired by Google. Xfire helps gamers play online with their friends and was acquired by MTV for $110 million. Direct Hit was a revolutionary search engine whose customers included MSN, Lycos, AOL, etc. and was acquired by Ask.com for $500 million. Stylus Innovation’s flagship product was computer telephony software Visual Voice. Artisoft acquired Stylus for $13M. Mike has a BS/MS in Aerospace Engineering from MIT. He graduated from Harvard Business School.

Rick Klau

Rick is a Partner at Google Ventures where he is responsible for leading Startup Lab. Rick was previously a Product Manager at Google where he led product initiatives on Blogger, Google+, and YouTube.

Rick’s earlier professional experience includes leadership roles at several software and Internet startups. He was an early employee at FeedBurner, where he ran the publisher services team until Google acquired the company in 2007. Rick received dual degrees from Lafayette College, and while a student at the University of Richmond School of Law, he founded the Richmond Journal of Law & Technology, the world’s first student-edited law journal to publish exclusively online. He serves on Richmond Law’s Alumni Association Board of Directors.


What is Startup Weekend

Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurs. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

Who should attend?

Anyone who wants to learn or loves the process of creating a new product or service and turning it into a business. There will be 100 attendees including makers, programmers, marketers, designers, builders, entrepreneurs and writers.
Why should I attend?

To become inspired, forge lasting friendships, find co-founders and employees, learn new tools and methodologies, practice new skills and feel a sense of accomplishment.
Participating in Startup Weekend is an intense experience that allows you to grow rapidly and build deep relationships. It’s an experience like none other.
What can I expect?

Attendees meet Friday at 5:00pm and start getting to know each other. After a dinner and an inspiring presentation by a Google Director and serial entrepreneur, Mike Cassidy, you’ll spend the weekend building a new product and will launch it Sunday at 5pm.
How do I sign up?

Select a ticket from one of the categories above. If you fit multiple categories, pick your strongest for now. You will not be restricted to this role during the weekend. If you don’t know which to pick, select Non-Technical for now.
Where can I find out more?

If you have other questions, visit the Startup Weekend Bay Area website or check out the Startup Weekend FAQ.
Refund Policy

No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

events.name: Dart Hackathon - Silicon Valley
events.about:
The Dart team invites you to Happy Hour, the first global Dart hackathon, sponsored by Google and produced by the community. Sign up to participate at one of our many locations across the globe.

Be part of the next evolution of web programming. Make an impact by hacking on Dart and sharing your feedback. The team is eager to learn from you. Join us!

Learn more at the Dart Hackathon site.

events.name: MEGA Startup Weekend 2 04/13 to 04/15
events.about: Startup Weekend is an intense 54 hour event which focuses on building a web or mobile application which could form the basis of a credible business over the course of a weekend. The weekend brings together people with different skillsets - primarily software developers, graphics designers and business people - to build applications and develop a commercial case around them.

events.name: CodeChix Presents: Mobile/Web Graphic Design for Engineers (Women only)
events.about:
You just hacked up an app, and its awesome. But youre ashamed to share it with anyone because it looks ugly. Come to this workshop and learn the basic photoshop skills to create an icon, choose a color palette and make pretty buttons. Dress up your app and be proud!

Please note:  The event is free.  However, we humbly ask for a donation of $5 for bringing you this event.  And, if you would like to purchase a CodeChix T-shirt for a donation of $15, we would be very grateful.
